intro: Phyllostegia brevilobata, commonly known as the narrow-lobed strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
